data.title: Fly on the Wall with Dana Carvey and David Spade Podcast Summary with Dana Carvey, David Spade, Will Arnett
data.meta_description: In this episode of Fly on the Wall with Dana Carvey and David Spade learn about Starting out in comedy, and other important topics. Read a summary today.
data.text:
Step into the humorous dynamics of "Fly on the Wall with Dana Carvey and David Spade," as comedy legends Dana Carvey and David Spade, along with special guest Will Arnett, delve into the laughter-laden trenches of show business and the evolving nature of fame. This revealing episode peels back the curtain on Spade's comedic roots, from his early days facing adversity in the restaurant industry to his storied tenure on "Saturday Night Live" where live television blended humor with real-time cultural commentary.

Listen as Spade and Arnett reminisce about their collaborative shenanigans on shows like "Snake Oil," giving listeners a glimpse into the off-screen chemistry that fuels their onscreen performances. Meanwhile, they tackle the profound impact of social media on modern celebrity and the consumption of entertainment, contrasting the bygone allure of classic stardom with today's viral content culture. Join this trio of comic minds as they weigh in on the wit and whimsy of the entertainment world, both past and present, in an insightful and amusing conversation that's sure to tickle your funny bone.

Starting out in comedy

David Spade shares his initial foray into comedy, marked by a series of unsuccessful jobs in the restaurant industry where he struggled as a busboy and was fired from every restaurant job he had. Spade recalls how his humorous interactions with customers led to criticism from his managers and ultimately his termination. Despite believing that his comedic talent brought something extra to the customer experience, his attempts to entertain guests with jokes, like commenting on shark being on the menu, were not appreciated by his employers.

Memories from Saturday Night Live

Spade reflects on his time at "Saturday Night Live" (SNL), recognizing its special role in reacting to current events live on television. The show's cast members, including Spade, experienced live television moments during major news events, providing unforgettable experiences. SNL has handled these situations with a mix of solemnity and satire, offering entertainment while also commenting on the news, illustrating the show's deep connection with the cultural and political atmosphere.

The impact of social media

In examining social media's effect, Spade and Arnett discuss its significant transformation of celebrity and fame. Spade observes how social media showcases previously unnoticed talents, altering the nature of what actions are valued. Social media's immediate sharing has changed the landscape of public appearances, from movie premieres to the mystique of classic movie stars. The constant visibility of modern celebrities contrasts with the exclusive aura of stars like Paul Newman. Spade and Arnett also voice their concerns about the substance of content promoted on social media. Spade critiques the virality of low-quality content, while Arnett comments on its lack of wit, contrasting it with genuine humor.

Will and David's experiences working together

Spade and Arnett have a history of working together, sharing a good rapport and enjoyable memories from shows like "Snake Oil" on Fox. They laugh over incidents such as Spade consistently guessing wrong on the authenticity of bizarre products and a contestant overlooking Arnett's advice. Their shared anecdotes from working on the game show highlight the comedic and collaborative aspects of their relationship, underscoring the fun they have had together on set.

David Spade recounts his early attempts at breaking into the world of comedy, which included a series of unsuccessful stints in the restaurant industry.

Struggling to make it as a waiter

While working at a restaurant, Spade faced criticism from his manager for talking to customers instead of just performing his duties as a busboy. Spade recalls doing all the hard work, such as cleaning up, while the waiters simply took orders and moved on. Yet, he was unable to advance to the position of waiter.

Getting fired from multiple restaurant jobs

Will Arnett and David Spade share a friendly camaraderie and have fond memories from their time working together on various projects.

Fun memories from projects like Snake Oil

David Spade and Will Arnett reminisce about their fun experience while working on the game show "Snake Oil" for Fox. Spade, acknowledging their strong friendship, shares a laugh with Arnett as they recall the challenge of figuring out which bizarre products were real or fake on the show, with Spade humorously admitting that he guessed wrong every single time, even during reruns.
